botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Regal pelargoniums are evergreen perennials or subshrubs, bushy in habit, with rounded, often lobed leaves and usually single flowers to 4cm across, borne in clusters in late spring and into summer, in shades of pink, red, orange and purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile well-drained soil. Feed regularly through the growing season. Over winter in frost-free conditions in good light. See pelargonium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings of non-flowering shoots in spring or summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead regularly. Cut back if bringing older plants indoors for overwintering
how_to_grow.pests: Generally trouble-free but may be susceptible to the usual glasshouse pests such as aphids in spring and glasshouse whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble-free but may be susceptible to grey moulds, pelargonium rust and Pelargonium viruses
